title: How to connect my laptop to the internet with a SIM card - Quora

response.answer_text: Cellular dongle — a small cellular modem that plugs into a USB port. Small antennas, but easy to set up and use. Typically these are powered by your laptop power.MiFi device — external cellular data that connects via WiFi. Contains a battery that will likely fail if used 24x7. Some are in the form of a puck that can connect to your computer by a cable.Cellular gateway — external device that is typically not portable. Many, but not all support external antennas, which can give you a better connection in remote areas. Best versions should connect via a Gigabit Wired Ethernet port. These typically have a power adapter for wall power, and some are designed for 24x7 use.Cell phone — You can use tether via a cable, WiFi, or sometimes Bluetooth. Best for occasional use.

Yes there are devices which usually plug into a USB slot. While I’ve heard of tablets with built in sim slots I’ve never heard of a laptop. Was looking into one before I realized for the one time use it would be cheaper to add data to my phone and teather that.
